bug.author: joobei
bug.summary: Output from mlagents-learn -s config/trainer_config.yaml --run-id=first-run --train --debug same as mlagents-learn without any arguments
bug.description:
Describe the bug The output from mlagents-learn -s config/trainer_config.yaml --run-id=first-run --train --debug is exactly the same as running mlagents-learn without any arguments To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
switch to conda mlagents environment run mlagents-learn -s config/trainer_config.yaml --run-id=first-run --train --debug See output
<denchmark-link:https://i.imgur.com/i8WGVu7.png>Screenshot (imgur)</denchmark-link>
Environment (please complete the following information):
OS + version: Ubuntu 18.04 ML-Agents version: d112298 from source. Environment: ball balancing but I was never asked to press play in Unity.

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/joobei>@joobei</denchmark-link> , what is the "-s" used for here? mlagents-learn doesn't use such an argument.

This is embarassing . I could have sworn I copy-pasted the command line from the Basic-Guide.md Oh well perhaps this should be marked as an improvement request for people like me who randomly add command line arguments, some message that says "no such command line argument exists".
